ground_truth: Bullets fly, and every few moments another cannon ball smashes into the piled debris. The big gun has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit. Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades, firing at the attackers, handing their rifles down to others to be re-loaded, firing again. The hard core of student fighters retreat, firing as they go, into the Café Musain. Marius takes a bullet, and crumples and falls. Valjean runs towards him - CRASH! The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are storming through. Students driving back the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase, smashing it to fragments - the soldiers below fire up at them - students fall, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers fight in the café, on the stairs, up the stairs to the upper room. The students' ammunition has run out, they're hurling sticks and bottles - but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up, shooting as they come, and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers. Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage. The soldiers break through at last to the upper room, to find there's only Enjolras still alive. He stands by the window, knowing he will die now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him, the soldiers hesitate. Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his eyes. He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge. He begins to move away along the embankment, up steps, towards a bridge. He's unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain. He climbs up onto the parapet, reaching his arms up to the night sky. Here he stands, looking down at the dark water of the night river. The Seine forms a whirlpool here, where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge. He reaches higher, turning his body, twisting, as if he wants some angel from on high to save him - and so, turning, he falls into the river. The swirling eddies close over him. And he's lost. Women move about the street, seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade. These are both the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they died, united now in their grief. Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway. There stands Cosette, waiting for him. Cosette holds Marius, supporting him, as he enters the house.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Projectiles soar, and every few instants another cannonball crashes into the heaped wreckage. The large artillery has been aligned with the gateway and has exploded right through in the initial strike. Enjolras and the pupils hurl themselves onto the barricades, shooting at the assailants, passing their firearms down to others to be reloaded, firing anew. The firm nucleus of scholar combatants withdraw, shooting as they depart, into the Café Musain. Marius receives a projectile, and collapses and drops. Valjean dashes towards him - CRASH! The latest cannonade blasts an opening in the barricade and now the troops are charging through. Students pushing back the chasing soldiers chop away at the stairway, shattering it to pieces - the soldiers below shoot up at them - students tumble, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers clash in the café, on the stairs, up the stairs to the upper chamber. The students’ munitions have depleted, they're throwing sticks and bottles - but the soldiers have discovered a method to climb up, firing as they advance, and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his embrace and is shielding him from the rush of the troops. Valjean carries Marius away from the slaughter. The soldiers breach at last to the upper chamber, to find there's only Enjolras remaining alive. He stands by the window, knowing he will perish now, dignified and unafraid. Seeing him, the soldiers pause. Javert draws his revolver and holds it to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his gaze. He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge. He begins to move away along the embankment, up steps, towards a bridge. He's oblivious of everything except the chaos in his mind. He climbs up onto the railing, extending his arms up to the nocturnal sky. Here he stands, gazing down at the shadowy water of the night river. The Seine forms a vortex here, where fierce currents swirl around the piers of the bridge. He reaches higher, rotating his body, twisting, as if he desires some celestial being from above to rescue him - and so, rotating, he plunges into the river. The swirling eddies envelop him. And he's lost. Women move about the street, seeking their deceased loved ones among the corpses that still litter the barricade. These are both the bourgeois mothers of the students - Enjolras’s mother, Grantaire’s sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they perished, united now in their sorrow. Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway. There stands Cosette, anticipating him. Cosette holds Marius, sustaining him, as he enters the residence.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Bullets are flown, and every few moments another cannonball is smashed into the piled debris. The gate is lined up with the big gun and it bursts right through in the first hit. Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades, firing at the attackers; rifles are handed down by them to others to be re-loaded, and then they are fired again. The Café Musain is retreated into by the hard core of student fighters, who fire as they go. Marius is taken by a bullet, and he crumples and falls. Valjean is running towards him - CRASH! A hole is burst in the barricade by the latest cannonade and now the soldiers storm through. The staircase is hacked away at and smashed into fragments by students driving back the pursuing soldiers - fires are shot up at them by the soldiers below - students fall, their bodies are caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. The café, the stairs, and up the stairs to the upper room are fought in by students and soldiers. The students' ammunition runs out; sticks and bottles are hurled by them - but a way to clamber up is found by the soldiers, who shoot as they come, and one by one the students fall. Marius is in Valjean's arms and he is hidden from the onrush of the soldiers by Valjean. Marius is carried away from the carnage by Valjean. The upper room is broken through at last by the soldiers, to find only Enjolras still alive. The window is stood by him, knowing he will die now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him, hesitation is felt by the soldiers. Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head. His eyes are met by Valjean. The embankment is moved up from by him onto the bridge. The embankment is moved away from by him, up steps, towards a bridge. Everything except the turmoil in his brain is unaware to him. The parapet is climbed up onto by him, his arms reaching up to the night sky. Here he stands, looking down at the dark water of the night river. A whirlpool is formed by the Seine here, where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge. Higher is reached by him, turning his body, twisting, as if by some angel from on high he wants to be saved - and so, turning, the river is fallen into by him. He is closed over by the swirling eddies. And he is lost. The street is moved about by women, seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade. Both the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they died, are now united in their grief. Slowly, the chair is risen from by him and turned to the doorway. Cosette stands there, waiting for him. Marius is held by Cosette, who supports him, as the house is entered by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Bullets fly, and cannonballs smash into the debris. The cannon lines up with the gate, breaking through on the first hit. Enjolras and the students dive onto the barricades, firing and reloading. The core student fighters retreat, firing as they withdraw into Café Musain. Marius is shot and falls. Valjean rushes to him—CRASH! A cannonade breaks the barricade, and soldiers storm in. Students hack the staircase to fragments, while soldiers fire up, hitting students whose bodies catch on jagged stairs. Fighting continues in the café and up to the upper room, but the students run out of ammunition, resorting to sticks and bottles. Soldiers climb, shooting, causing students to fall one by one. Valjean hides Marius from the soldiers and carries him away. Soldiers reach the upper room to find only Enjolras alive. He stands proudly by the window, unafraid. The soldiers hesitate upon seeing him. Javert aims his pistol at Valjean. Valjean climbs the parapet, raising his arms to the night sky. He stands, looking down at the dark river, where violent currents swirl. As if seeking salvation, he turns and falls into the river, lost in the eddies. Women search among bodies for loved ones. Middle-class mothers and working women are united in grief. Slowly, he rises and turns to the doorway, where Cosette awaits, supporting Marius as they enter the house.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Bullets fly, and cannonballs smash debris. The big gun hits the gate on the first try. Enjolras and the students fire at attackers and reload their rifles, retreating to the Café Musain. Marius is shot and falls; Valjean rushes to him. A cannonball breaks the barricade, and soldiers storm in. Students destroy the staircase to stop them, but soldiers shoot from below, killing more students. Fighting continues in the café; students out of ammunition throw sticks and bottles. Soldiers climb up, shooting students. Valjean carries Marius away. Soldiers reach the upper room, finding only Enjolras alive, standing bravely. Javert points a pistol at Valjean. Valjean, lost in thought, climbs a parapet and falls into the Seine, disappearing. Women search for loved ones among the dead. Middle-class and working-class women mourn together. Valjean rises and sees Cosette, who holds Marius as he enters the house.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Bullets are flying through the air with relentless intensity, and every few moments, another heavy cannon ball crashes violently into the accumulated debris. The imposing, formidable gun has been perfectly aligned with the barricade's gate and has blasted directly through it in a single, devastating hit. Enjolras, along with the brave students, hurls themselves onto the barricades, firing their weapons at the advancing attackers, diligently handing their rifles down to others for reloading, then promptly firing once more. The staunch core of student fighters strategically retreats, all the while continuing to fire as they make their way into the Café Musain. In the chaos, Marius is struck by a bullet, causing him to crumple to the ground and fall. Quick to act, Valjean dashes towards him—CRASH! The latest powerful cannonade breaches a hole in the barricade, and now, the soldiers are surging through with force. The students, in a desperate attempt to repel the pursuing soldiers, hack away ferociously at the staircase, smashing it into mere fragments—the soldiers below retaliate by firing upwards at them, resulting in students falling, their bodies tragically caught on the jagged remnants of the shattered stairs. Combat continues intensely within the café, on the stairway, and up the stairs leading to the upper room. The situation grows dire as the students' ammunition is entirely depleted; they resort to throwing sticks and bottles—but the soldiers have discovered a way to clamber up, shooting as they ascend, and one by one, the valiant students fall. Valjean, with unwavering resolve, has Marius in his arms, shielding him from the relentless onrush of the soldiers. Valjean steadfastly carries Marius away from the heart-wrenching carnage. At last, the soldiers break through to the upper room, only to find that Enjolras is the sole survivor. He stands resolutely by the window, fully aware of his impending death, yet he remains proud and unafraid. The sight of him causes the soldiers to hesitate momentarily. Javert then draws his pistol, holding it threateningly to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his gaze with calm defiance. He proceeds to move up from the embankment onto the bridge. He commences moving away along the embankment, ascending steps, heading towards a bridge. His mind is consumed, unaware of anything except the turmoil relentlessly swirling in his brain. As he climbs up onto the parapet, he stretches his arms up towards the vast night sky. Here, he stands, gazing down at the dark, swirling waters of the river below. The Seine, at this point, forms a turbulent whirlpool where violent currents swirl around the bridge's piles. He reaches higher, his body turning and twisting, as if imploring some celestial angel to descend from on high and save him—and so, with a turn, he falls into the river below. The swirling and tumultuous eddies close over him. And just like that, he is lost. Women, consumed by grief, move solemnly about the street, seeking their lost loved ones among the lifeless bodies that still litter the ravaged barricade. These women include both the middle-class mothers of the students—Enjolras's grieving mother, Grantaire's mourning sister—and the working women from the slums for whom these brave souls fought and died, now united in their profound grief. Slowly, he rises from the chair and turns towards the doorway. There, waiting patiently for him, stands Cosette. Cosette holds Marius, supporting him tenderly, as he makes his way into the house.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With relentless and unforgiving intensity, bullets are ferociously flying through the air, creating a deadly atmosphere, while every few moments, another heavy, formidable cannonball violently crashes into the ever-growing pile of accumulated debris. The imposing and formidable gun has been meticulously and perfectly aligned with the central gate of the barricade and has blasted directly through it in just a single, devastating hit. Enjolras, along with the brave and determined students, fiercely hurl themselves onto the barricades, firing their weapons at the advancing attackers with determination, diligently handing their rifles down to their comrades for quick reloading, only to promptly fire once more. The staunch and unwavering core of student fighters strategically retreats, all the while continuing to fire as they deliberately make their way into the Café Musain, seeking a stronger position. In the chaos of battle, Marius is abruptly struck by a bullet, causing him to crumple to the ground and fall. Quick to act in this dire moment, Valjean dashes fervently towards Marius—CRASH! The latest powerful and overwhelming cannonade creates a significant breach, a gaping hole in the barricade, and now, with forceful momentum, the soldiers are surging through. The students, in a desperate and frantic attempt to repel the pursuing soldiers, hack away ferociously at the staircase, smashing it into mere fragments and splinters—the soldiers below retaliate viciously by firing upwards at them, resulting in students tragically falling, their bodies becoming ensnared on the jagged remnants of the shattered stairs. Combat continues with intense fervor and desperation within the café, on the swiftly deteriorating stairway, and up the stairs that lead to the upper room. The situation grows increasingly dire as the students' ammunition becomes entirely depleted; they resort to throwing sticks and bottles in their desperate defense—but the soldiers have discovered a way to clamber up, shooting relentlessly as they ascend, and one by one, the valiant students fall. Valjean, with unwavering resolve and determination, has Marius firmly in his arms, shielding him from the relentless onrush of the soldiers. Valjean steadfastly carries Marius away from the heart-wrenching carnage that surrounds them. At last, the soldiers, with their overwhelming numbers, break through to the upper room, only to find that Enjolras stands as the sole survivor. He stands resolutely and bravely by the window, fully aware of his impending death, yet he remains proud and utterly unafraid. The sight of him causes the soldiers to hesitate, albeit momentarily. Javert, with a menacing demeanor, draws his pistol, holding it threateningly to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his gaze with calm defiance, undeterred. He proceeds to move thoughtfully up from the embankment onto the bridge. He commences moving away, along the embankment, ascending the steps, heading determinedly towards the bridge. His mind is consumed and preoccupied, unaware of anything around him, except the turmoil relentlessly swirling in his brain. As he climbs up onto the parapet, he stretches his arms upward towards the vast night sky. Here, he stands, gazing contemplatively down at the dark, swirling waters of the river below. The Seine, at this point, forms a turbulent and hazardous whirlpool where violent currents swirl and eddy around the bridge's piles. He reaches ever higher, his body turning and twisting, as if imploring some celestial angel to descend from on high and save him—and so, with a turn, he ultimately falls into the river below. The swirling and tumultuous eddies close over him. And just like that, he is lost. Women, consumed by profound and overwhelming grief, move solemnly about the street, seeking their lost loved ones among the lifeless bodies that still litter the ravaged barricade. These women include both the middle-class mothers of the gallant students—Enjolras's deeply grieving mother, Grantaire's mourning sister—and the working women from the impoverished slums for whom these brave souls fought and died, now united together in their profound grief. Slowly, he rises from the chair and turns towards the doorway. There, waiting patiently and lovingly for him, stands Cosette. Cosette holds Marius, tenderly supporting him as he makes his way into the house, offering a glimmer of hope amidst the sorrow.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Amidst the chaos, bullets zip through the air, punctuating the scene with sharp, explosive sounds, while cannonballs periodically crash into the towering debris of the barricade. The imposing, strategically positioned cannon aligns perfectly with the gate and with a thunderous first shot, breaches through effortlessly. Enjolras and his fellow students, galvanized by urgency, launch themselves onto the barricades, firing relentlessly at the approaching attackers. They seamlessly pass their rifles to comrades behind them for reloading, reclaim them, and continue their desperate defensive assault. As the core group of determined student fighters strategically withdraws, they retreat into the relative haven of the Café Musain, maintaining a barrage of gunfire to cover their movements. In the ensuing melee, Marius takes a hit, a bullet finding its mark, causing him to crumple and collapse to the ground. Valjean, with immediate concern etched across his face, dashes toward Marius, only to be halted by the deafening crash of another cannonade that tears a fresh breach into the barricade, allowing soldiers to pour through the gap. In a fierce bid to stall the enemy advance, students, driven by sheer desperation, hack at the staircase, reducing it to fragmented wood, while the soldiers below return fire, sending students tumbling, bodies tragically impaled on the jagged remnants of stairs. The battle intensifies within the confines of the café, on the stairways, and ascending towards the upper room, where hand-to-hand combat erupts. As the students exhaust their ammunition, they resort to hurling sticks and bottles, their defenses dwindling as soldiers discover a route upward, each enemy advancing with gunfire, steadily felling the youthful resistance. Amidst this dire scene, Valjean cradles Marius, shielding him from the relentless advance, before whisking him away from the violent fray. Yet, the soldiers finally breach the upper room, only to encounter Enjolras, who alone stands resolute by the window, bracing for his inevitable fate with unwavering pride and courage. The soldiers momentarily falter, confronted by his fearless demeanor. Meanwhile, Javert levels his pistol at Valjean's head, their eyes locking in a moment of intense confrontation. Valjean then moves away, ascending from the embankment onto the bridge, his mind a chaos of turmoil as he ascends the steps leading to the bridge, oblivious to all else. Reaching the parapet, he extends his arms toward the starlit sky, balancing precariously while gazing down at the dark, churning waters of the river below. The Seine, with its swirling eddies, creates a violent whirlpool encircling the bridge's piers, as Valjean reaches higher, twisting his form skyward, as if beseeching salvation from a guardian angel. In this anguished, fateful moment, he pivots and plummets into the river, the swirling currents quickly enveloping him, and he disappears into the depths. On the streets, women, driven by heart-wrenching grief, search through the fallen, seeking their beloved among the lifeless bodies strewn across the barricade. These bereaved figures include both middle-class mothers, like Enjolras's mother and Grantaire's sister, as well as the working-class women of the slums, now united in shared sorrow over the lives lost in the struggle. In a separate scene, he slowly rises from the chair and turns toward the doorway, where Cosette stands, patiently awaiting him. In her arms, Cosette supports Marius as he crosses the threshold into the house.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Bullets fly as the cannon breaks through the gate, and Enjolras and the students advance onto the barricades, continuously firing and reloading. As the core group retreats into the Café Musain, Marius is wounded and collapses. Valjean rushes to him just as a cannonade breaches the barricade, allowing soldiers to infiltrate. In the ensuing battle, students destroy the staircase to hold off the soldiers, leading to a fierce fight within the café. Despite running out of ammunition, the students resort to throwing debris but are gradually overcome by the advancing soldiers. Valjean shields Marius from the chaos and escapes. Enjolras stands alone in the upper room, awaiting his fate with courage, causing the soldiers to pause. Meanwhile, Javert confronts Valjean, and in a moment of turmoil, Valjean wanders to a bridge, lost in thought, before leaping into the swirling waters of the Seine. The scene shifts to women searching through the fallen at the barricade, united in grief for their lost loved ones. Finally, Valjean rises, meets Cosette at the doorway, and she supports Marius as they enter the house.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Bullets fly, a brutal reminder of the intensity of the 1832 Paris uprising, and every few moments another cannonball, a staple in military artillery during the period, smashes into the piled debris. The big gun, a heavy artillery piece used to breach fortifications, has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit. Enjolras and the students, their idealism fueling their courage, throw themselves onto the barricades, firing at the attackers, handing their rifles down to others to be re-loaded, firing again in a desperate bid to hold their ground. The hard core of student fighters retreat, firing as they go, into the Café Musain, which served as a meeting place for revolutionaries. Marius takes a bullet, a painful consequence of his commitment, and crumples and falls. Valjean, a man whose life has been a journey from darkness to redemption, runs towards him - CRASH! The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers, disciplined forces of the government, are storming through. Students driving back the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase in a last-ditch effort to slow the advance, smashing it to fragments - the soldiers below fire up at them - students fall, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers fight in the café, on the stairs, up the stairs to the upper room that had once been filled with laughter and hope. The students' ammunition has run out, they're hurling sticks and bottles - but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up, shooting as they come, and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers, determined to save the young man his daughter loves. Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage. The soldiers break through at last to the upper room, to find there's only Enjolras still alive. He stands by the window, a symbol of defiance, knowing he will die now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him, the soldiers hesitate, momentarily awed by his bravery. Javert, the relentless inspector who has pursued Valjean for years, draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his eyes, signifying a lifetime of struggle. He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge, a metaphorical crossing from one phase of life to another. He begins to move away along the embankment, up steps, towards a bridge. He's unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain, a chaos of emotions and memories. He climbs up onto the parapet, reaching his arms up to the night sky in a plea for salvation. Here he stands, looking down at the dark water of the night river. The Seine, which flows through the heart of Paris, forms a whirlpool here, where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge. He reaches higher, turning his body, twisting, as if he wants some angel from on high to save him - and so, turning, he falls into the river. The swirling eddies close over him, pulling him into the depths. And he's lost. Women move about the street, seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade. These are both the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they died, united now in their grief over the shared cost of revolution. Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway. There stands Cosette, Valjean’s adopted daughter and Marius's beloved, waiting for him. Cosette holds Marius, supporting him, as he enters the house, a haven from the chaos outside.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Bullets fly and every few moments another cannon ball smashes into the piled debris. The big gun has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit. Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades firing at the attackers handing their rifles down to others to be reloaded firing again. The hard core of student fighters retreat firing as they go into the Café Musain. Marius takes a bullet and crumples and falls. Valjean runs towards him. CRASH. The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are storming through. Students driving back. the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase smashing it to fragments. the soldiers below fire up at them. students fall their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers fight in the café on the stairs up the stairs to the upper room. The students' ammunition has run out. they are hurling sticks and bottles  but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up shooting as they come and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers. Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage. The soldiers break through at last to the upper room to find there is only Enjolras still alive. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. He stands by the window knowing he will die now proud and unafraid. Seeing him the soldiers hesitate. Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his eyes. He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge. He begins to move away along the embankment up steps towards a bridge. He is unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain. He climbs up onto the parapet reaching his arms up to the night sky. Here he stands looking down at the dark water of the night river. The Seine forms a whirlpool here where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge. He reaches higher turning his body twisting as if he wants some angel from on high to save him  and so turning he falls into the river. The swirling eddies close over him. And he is lost. Women move about the street seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade. These are both the middleclass mothers of the students. Enjolras's mother Grantaire's sister  and the working women of the slums for whom they died united now in their grief. Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway. There stands Cosette waiting for him. Cosette holds Marius supporting him as he enters the house.

Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades firing at the attackers handing their rifles down to others to be reloaded firing again. The hard core of student fighters retreat firing as they go into the Café Musain. Marius takes a bullet and crumples and falls. Valjean runs towards him. CRASH. The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are storming through. Students driving back. the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase smashing it to fragments. the soldiers below fire up at them. students fall their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers fight in the café on the stairs up the stairs to the upper room. The students' ammunition has run out. they are hurling sticks and bottles  but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up shooting as they come and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers. Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage. The soldiers break through at last to the upper room to find there is only Enjolras still alive. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. The hard core of student fighters retreat, firing as they go, into the Library Musain. Marius takes an arrow, and crumples and falls. Valjean runs towards him - BOOM! The latest explosion bursts a hole in the sandbags and now the soldiers are storming through. Students driving back the pursuing soldiers hack away at the ladder, smashing it to fragments - the soldiers below fire up at them - students fall, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the ladder. Students and soldiers fight in the library, on the ladder, up the ladder to the attic. The students' ammunition has run out, they're hurling twigs and cups - but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up, shooting as they come, and one by one the students are falling. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers. Valjean carries Marius away from the wreckage. The soldiers break through at last to the attic, to find there's only Enjolras still alive. He stands by the balcony, knowing he will die now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him, the soldiers hesitate. Javert draws his slingshot and holds it to Valjean's head. Valjean meets his eyes. He moves up from the sidewalk onto the dock. He begins to move away along the sidewalk, up steps, towards a dock. He's unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain. He climbs up onto the railing, reaching his arms up to the night sky. Here he stands, looking down at the dark pool of the night pond. The pond forms a whirlpool here, where violent currents swirl around the posts of the dock. He reaches higher, turning his body, twisting, as if he wants some angel from on high to save him - and so, turning, he falls into the pond. The swirling eddies close over him. And he's lost. Women move about the street, seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the sandbags. These are both the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the markets for whom they died, united now in their grief. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Bullets bounce, and every few moments another cannon ball skims past the piled debris. The big gun has been aimed at the gate and has glanced off in the first hit. Enjolras and the students leap onto the barricades, shouting at the attackers, tossing their rifles down to others to be re-loaded, shouting again. The hard core of student fighters dance, laughing as they go, into the Café Musain. Marius takes a bullet, and tumbles and rolls. Valjean strolls towards him - CRASH! The latest cannonade chips a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are strolling through. Students waving at the pursuing soldiers glance at the staircase, nudging it to fragments - the soldiers below wave up at them - students drop, their bodies wedged on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Students and soldiers chat in the café, on the stairs, up the stairs to the upper room. The students' ammunition has disappeared, they're juggling sticks and bottles - but the soldiers have found a way to tiptoe up, waving as they come, and one by one the students are sleeping. Valjean has Marius in his arms and is shielding him from the onrush of the soldiers. Valjean leads Marius away from the chaos. The soldiers charge through at last to the upper room, to find there's only Enjolras still resting. He stands by the window, knowing he will sleep now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him, the soldiers pause. Javert draws his pistol and points it to Valjean's head. Valjean catches his eyes. He climbs down from the embankment onto the bridge. He begins to skip away along the embankment, down steps, towards a bridge. He's wary of everything except the calm in his brain. He jumps up onto the parapet, waving his arms up to the night sky. Here he stands, staring down at the dark water of the night river. The Seine forms a ripple here, where gentle currents circle around the piles of the bridge. He reaches lower, turning his body, spinning, as if he wants some angel from on high to scold him - and so, spinning, he rises into the river. The swirling eddies open under him. And he's found. Women glide about the street, embracing their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade. These are both the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they lived, united now in their joy. Slowly he sinks into the chair and turns to the window. There stands Cosette, smiling at him. Cosette hugs Marius, guiding him, as he leaves the house.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Arrows fly, and every few moments another volleyball crashes into the stacked books. The large lamp has been aligned with the refrigerator and has burst right through in the first attempt. The dolphin and the kittens throw themselves onto the wardrobes, shouting at the bakers, handing their umbrellas down to others to be repaired, shouting again. The hard core of kitten swimmers retreat, shouting as they go, into the Library of Congress. Christopher takes a sandwich, and tumbles and drops. Arthur runs towards him - BANG! The latest piñata explodes a hole in the wardrobe, and now the bakers are rushing through. Kittens driving back the pursuing bakers carve away at the treadmill, breaking it to fragments - the bakers below shout up at them - kittens drop, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the treadmill. Kittens and bakers argue in the library, on the treadmill, up the treadmill to the attic. The kittens' candy has run out, they're throwing hats and mugs - but the bakers have found a way to scramble up, yelling as they come, and one by one the kittens are dropping. Arthur has Christopher in his arms and is shielding him from the stampede of the bakers. Arthur carries Christopher away from the confusion. The bakers break through at last to the attic, to find there's only the dolphin still breathing. It stands by the door, aware it will drop now, dignified and fearless. Seeing it, the bakers pause. Detective draws its camera and points it to Arthur's shoe. Arthur meets its goggles. He moves up from the meadow onto the footbridge. He begins to move away along the meadow, up ladders, towards a footbridge. He's unaware of everything except the chaos in his heart. He climbs up onto the railing, reaching his feet up to the morning clouds. Here he stands, looking down at the swirling carpet of the day ocean. The Amazon forms a cyclone here, where gentle breezes swirl around the beams of the footbridge. He reaches higher, turning his tire, twisting, as if he wants some penguin from on high to fetch him - and so, turning, he drops into the ocean. The swirling waves close over him. And he's misplaced. Children move about the park, finding their lost novels among the sandwiches that still litter the wardrobe. These are both the upper-class fathers of the kittens - the dolphin's father, Grantaire's roommate - and the singing children of the mountains for whom they sang, united now in their tunes. Slowly he rises from the bed and turns to the window. There waits Violet, waving for him. Violet holds Christopher, lifting him, as he exits the boat.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Arrows soar, and every few moments another arrowhead rolls into the collected wreckage. The large catapult has been arranged with the archway and has vanished right through in the first attempt. Courfeyrac and the teachers fling themselves onto the defenses, shouting at the intruders, passing their spears down to others to be sharpened, shouting again. The inner circle of teacher defenders advance, shouting as they leave, into the Café Lamarque. Combeferre catches a stone, and collapses and stumbles. Javert sprints towards him - BANG! The latest charge explodes a chasm in the barrier and now the sailors are creeping through. Teachers driving back the chasing sailors chip away at the staircase, tearing it to splinters - the sailors below aim up at them - teachers tumble, their bodies trapped on the jagged shards of the stairs. Teachers and sailors grapple in the café, on the stairs, up the stairs to the upper chamber. The teachers' food has run out, they're tossing stones and books - but the sailors have found a way to scuttle up, shouting as they ascend, and one by one the teachers are dropping. Javert has Combeferre in his arms and is shielding him from the surge of the sailors. Javert drags Combeferre away from the uproar. The sailors break through at last to the upper chamber, to find there's only Courfeyrac still breathing. He rests by the entrance, knowing he will retreat now, defiant and unflinching. Seeing him, the sailors pause. Enjolras draws his sword and points it to Javert's chest. Javert returns his glare. He shifts down from the riverbank onto the shoreline. He begins to drift away along the riverbank, down steps, towards a bridge. He's oblivious to everything except the chaos in his mind. He clambers up onto the railing, stretching his arms up to the night clouds. Here he lingers, gazing down at the still water of the night lake. The Rhône forms a torrent here, where gentle streams twist around the beams of the bridge. He stretches higher, bending his form, pivoting, as if he wants some bird from below to lift him - and so, pivoting, he leaps into the lake. The peaceful waves close over him. And he's vanished. Children move about the alley, searching their lost playmates among the relics that still cover the rampart. These are both the upper-class fathers of the teachers - Courfeyrac's father, Bahorel's brother - and the working children of the markets for whom they fought, united now in their sorrow. Gently he shifts from the bench and turns to the hallway. There stands Éponine, waiting for him. Éponine reaches for Combeferre, guiding him, as he exits the library.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Arrows soar, and every few moments another firework bursts into the stacked crates. The large balloon has been aligned with the fountain and has popped right through on the first jump. Enjolras and the students fling themselves onto the fortifications, tossing at the defenders, passing their slingshots down to others to be re-supplied, tossing again. The core group of student skirmishers advance, tossing as they proceed, into the Music Hall. Marius takes an arrow, and collapses and tumbles. Valjean sprints towards him - BOOM! The latest pyrotechnic explodes a gap in the fortifications and now the guards are leaping through. Students rolling back the retreating guards chip away at the ladder, breaking it to splinters - the guards below toss up at them - students tumble, their figures snagged on the jagged pieces of the ladder. Students and guards brawl in the music hall, on the ladder, up the ladder to the upstairs room. The students' supplies have run dry; they're lobbing stones and cans - but the guards have found a passage to scramble up, tossing as they come, and one by one the students are tumbling. Valjean has Marius in his grasp and is shielding him from the surge of the guards. Valjean transports Marius away from the chaos. The guards break through at last to the upstairs room, to find there's only Enjolras still standing. He stands by the door, understanding he will tumble now, valiant and undaunted. Observing him, the guards pause. Javert lifts his bow and aims it at Valjean's chest. Valjean returns his gaze. He ascends from the dock onto the platform. He begins to drift away along the dock, up ramps, towards a platform. He's oblivious to everything except the havoc in his mind. He ascends onto the railing, reaching his legs up to the nebulous clouds. Here he stands, peering down at the shimmering water of the twilight ocean. The Seine forms a vortex here, where turbulent tides whirl around the beams of the platform. He reaches higher, twisting his figure, rotating, as if he desires some celestial being from above to rescue him - and so, rotating, he dives into the ocean. The swirling ripples close over him. And he's vanished. Men drift about the alley, searching for their deceased loved ones among the figures that still clutter the fortification. These are both the upper-class fathers of the students - Enjolras's father, Grantaire's brother - and the laboring men of the districts for whom they fought, intertwined now in their sorrow. Steadily he descends from the bench and turns to the alleyway. There stands Cosette, waiting for him. Cosette cradles Marius, balancing him, as he departs the den.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Pebbles soar, and every few seconds another beach ball crashes into the stacked furniture. The small drone has been aligned with the fence and has slipped right through on the initial attempt. Quackers and the pilots launch themselves onto the shanties, tossing cookies at the defenders, passing their bouquets to others to be discarded, tossing again. The soft group of pilot swimmers advance, tossing as they land, into the Bistro Beluga. Marvin catches a frisbee, and cartwheels and lands. Vincent strolls away from him - BOOM! The current drizzle erupts a gap in the shanty and now the gardeners are floating over. Pilots driving away the retreating gardeners paint over the ladder, slicing it to pieces - the gardeners above toss down at them - pilots climb, their backpacks dragged on the broken pieces of the ladder. Pilots and gardeners dance in the bistro, on the ladder, up the ladder to the lower space. The pilots' cupcakes have run dry, they're chucking balls and hats - but the gardeners have discovered a path to scramble down, dancing as they leap, and one by one the pilots are sliding. Vincent has Marvin in his shoes and is pushing him towards the retreat of the gardeners. Vincent drags Marvin towards the garden. The gardeners sneak over at last to the lower space, to notice there's only Quackers still asleep. He floats by the doorway, realizing he will nap now, shy and bewildered. Sighting him, the gardeners contemplate. Jared draws his accordion and holds it to Vincent's nose. Vincent averts his face. He scoots up from the sidewalk onto the boat. He begins to scoot away along the sidewalk, down ramps, towards a boat. He's oblivious to everything except the disarray in his thoughts. He glides down from the perch, stretching his toes down to the morning sky. Here he floats, gazing up at the bright air of the morning clouds. The Seine forms a whirlpool here, where gentle breezes drift about the roots of the boat. He stretches lower, turning his leg, flipping, as if he hopes some bird from below to catch him - and so, flipping, he rises into the cloud. The floating breezes lock under him. And he's found. Children skip along the park, searching their sleeping siblings among the ribbons that still decorate the shanty. These are both the working-class fathers of the pilots - Quackers's father, Grouse's brother - and the lounging children of the suburbs for whom they slept, separated now in their joy. Slowly she sinks from the sofa and turns to the window. There waits Bertha, hiding from her. Bertha holds Marvin, lifting him, as he exits the barn.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bullets fly as cannonballs smash debris. A cannon breaches the gate, and Enjolras and the students fire back, retreating into the Café Musain. Marius is shot, and Valjean rushes to him just as soldiers storm through. Students destroy the staircase, battling soldiers in the café. Out of ammunition, they throw sticks and bottles while the soldiers advance, shooting. Valjean carries Marius away from the chaos. Soldiers reach the upper room to find only Enjolras alive, standing proudly by the window. Javert aims his pistol at Valjean. Lost in thought, Valjean moves towards a bridge, climbs the parapet, and falls into the river, disappearing in the swirling currents. Women search for loved ones among the fallen, united in grief. Cosette supports Marius as he enters the house.

save him  and so turning he falls into the river The Seine forms a whirlpool here where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge Here he stands looking down at the dark water of the night river He climbs up onto the parapet reaching his arms up to the night sky He is unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain He begins to move away along the embankment up steps towards a bridge He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge Valjean meets his eyes Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head Seeing him the soldiers hesitate He stands by the window knowing he will die now proud and unafraid The soldiers break through at last to the upper room to find there is only Enjolras still alive Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers they are hurling sticks and bottles  but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up shooting as they come and one by one the students are falling The students' ammunition has run out Students and soldiers fight in the café on the stairs up the stairs to the upper room students fall their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs the soldiers below fire up at them the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase smashing it to fragments Students driving back The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are storming through CRASH Valjean runs towards him Marius takes a bullet and crumples and falls The hard core of student fighters retreat firing as they go into the Café Musain Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades firing at the attackers handing their rifles down to others to be reloaded firing again The big gun has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit Bullets fly and every few moments another cannon ball smashes into the piled debris

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: Valjean runs towards him Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head Students and soldiers fight in the café on the stairs up the stairs to the upper room the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase smashing it to fragments He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge Here he stands looking down at the dark water of the night river The Seine forms a whirlpool here where violent currents swirl around the piles of the bridge Marius takes a bullet and crumples and falls He is unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain The swirling eddies close over him Enjolras's mother Grantaire's sister  and the working women of the slums for whom they died united now in their grief Women move about the street seeking their dead loved ones among the bodies that still litter the barricade These are both the middleclass mothers of the students the soldiers below fire up at them students fall their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs Seeing him the soldiers hesitate He reaches higher turning his body twisting as if he wants some angel from on high to save him  and so turning he falls into the river Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage Cosette holds Marius supporting him as he enters the house CRASH He climbs up onto the parapet reaching his arms up to the night sky Bullets fly and every few moments another cannon ball smashes into the piled debris There stands Cosette waiting for him The students' ammunition has run out He stands by the window knowing he will die now proud and unafraid Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades firing at the attackers handing their rifles down to others to be reloaded firing again Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway And he is lost Valjean meets his eyes The hard core of student fighters retreat firing as they go into the Café Musain He begins to move away along the embankment up steps towards a bridge Students driving back they are hurling sticks and bottles  but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up shooting as they come and one by one the students are falling Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers The soldiers break through at last to the upper room to find there is only Enjolras still alive The big gun has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricade and now the soldiers are storming through
